NewWords.WordPhrase: n. a member of a coast guard 海岸警卫队队员
motion or operation 航行中；工作中
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The nationwide medical reform is now under way.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  硬纸盒，纸板箱
n.  炸弹
n. a frame for holding bombs; a framework or stand on or in which articles are placed 炮弹架；架
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Put these tools back in the rack.

NewWords.WordPhrase: ad. on land; to the shore 在岸上；向岸边
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Pull the boat ashore!

NewWords.WordPhrase: a.  of or in accordance with tradition 传统的，惯例的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. There are also people who come to take such courses as Chinese traditional medicine, painting, calligraphy and photography.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 火鸡
remove (sth.) to a place where it is usually stored 把……收起，放好
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The kids are asked to put all the toys away before they leave.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  the time of sunset 日落时分
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The fighting broke out about two hours after sundown.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 后甲板
n.  a current of air; the amount taken in by a single act of drinking or inhaling 气流；一次吸入（或饮入）的量
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He took a draught of beer.

NewWords.WordPhrase: begin to give serious attention to or deal with 开始认真思考（或做）
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Recently I've got to wondering why I am doing the part-time job.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  玉米穗轴
and so on 等等
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The patient can have apples, apple juice, apple sauce, and the rest.

NewWords.WordPhrase: seeking 寻求，探求  quest  n. the act of seeking or pursuing sth. 寻求，追求
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Tony went to the school library in quest of Mark Twain's novels.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt.  turn around to the opposite direction; exchange the positions of 反转；交换……的位置
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. They have made it clear that they will not reverse the decision to increase prices.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a.  spoken; of or connected with a verb 口头的；动词的，跟动词有关的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We have a verbal agreement with her.

NewWords.WordPhrase: think about, consider 考虑；思考
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Even when she didn't say anything you could see her turning things over in her mind.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v.  make or become bright or brighter （使）变亮，（使）变得更亮
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. His face brightened up when he was told to have won the first prize.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt.  pay back, reward 偿还，报答
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Peter's previous work with us has played an important role in our success, and we will repay him for his efforts some day.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a.  not pretending, honest 诚挚的，真诚的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. To any readers who feel annoyed please accept my sincere apologies.

NewWords.WordPhrase: ad.  for a long time without any stop 长久地
n. being thankful, thankfulness 感激，谢意
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I should like to express my gratitude to all members of the laboratory past and present for their contribution to the breakthrough.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. sth. that is said, esp. formally and officially 陈述；声明
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The trade union issued a statement opposing racial discrimination.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. deeply or sincerely felt 衷心的，由衷的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She gave him her heartfelt thanks.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. an expression of gratitude; understanding of the qualities or worth of sth. 感谢；欣赏
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We offer this small token by way of appreciation.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. of or relating to agriculture 农业的，农艺的
a. of or relating to machines or mechanics 机械的，机械学的
n. the town or city of one's birth, rearing or main residence 故乡，家乡
a. （对牧师的尊称，与the连用）尊敬的
during a ship's voyage on the sea 在海上航行
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The boats remained at sea for an average of ten days at a time.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a.  relating to one thing and not others; particular 明确的；具体的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The new system made it easier for employers to recruit workers based on specific needs.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. interest, benefit 利益，好处   on sb.'s behalf/on the behalf of sb. for sb.; in the interests of sb.; as the representative of sb. 为（某人），为了（某人）的利益；代表（某人）
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. On the behalf of my parents, I would like to express my gratitude to you for your help.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  a single fact, event, etc., expressing a general idea 实例，例子
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. There are many instances of good people and good deeds nowadays.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. highest in place or rank, predominant 最高的，突出的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The development of national economy appears to be the uppermost in people's minds.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. make the importance of (sth.) very clear to sb.; cause (sb.) to feel admiration or respect 使重视；使留下深刻印象
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I don't think his mother was very impressed by our behavior in the restaurant.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  the period of being a boy 少年时代
n. a short oral or written test 测验
v. make or become smaller or less （使）变小，（使）减少
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Her patience with the children diminished as the hours went by.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. leave uncovered; make accessible to 使暴露，使接触   be exposed to 暴露于；与……接触
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The soldiers were exposed to considerable danger.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. cover completely in a liquid; absorb deeply 使浸没；使沉迷   be immersed in 沉浸在；沉迷于
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I held my breath and completely immersed myself in the water, trying to stay under for as long as possible.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 察觉，意识
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. There has been an increasing awareness that many people are affected by crime.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a.  causing wonder, excellent 不可思议的，美妙的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I have got some marvelous news for you -- you're going to be promoted.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 祈祷，祷告
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She says her prayers before she gets into bed.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. bring or call together into a group; fit together the parts or pieces of 集合；装配
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The members of the tour group assembled at the airport for departure.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. thoughtful of the rights and feelings of others; marked by careful thought 体贴的；考虑周到的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Friendly and considerate, he invariably consults with people around him before taking decisions.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. scatter (drops or particles of sth.) on (sth.); scatter in small drops 将……洒在……上；洒
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Sprinkle the meat with salt and place it in the pan.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. a pleasant dreamy or romantic feeling 梦幻
v. remove (the load or cargo) from a ship, car, etc.; remove the load or cargo from (a ship, car, etc.) 卸（货）；将货从（车、船等）上卸下
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Unload everything from the boat and clean it thoroughly.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. （车、船、飞机等所载的）货物
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The ship called at the port to load its regular cargo of bananas.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. load again 再装
vi. become fainter; move back or away from a point 变得模糊；退去
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. With the passage of time, my unhappy memories of the place receded.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vi. assemble at a prearranged time and place （在预定的时间和地点）会合  n. a prearranged meeting 约会，会面
vt.  cause to conform; grant 使符合；给予
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The headmaster accorded me permission to attend the seminar.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. highest, uppermost 最高的，顶端的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. the topmost branches of a giant tree

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 扩音器，喇叭
v. 发出（刺耳的声音）；锉，刮
a. somewhat more than a hundred 一百多个   odd a. a little more than; that cannot be divided by two; strange 稍多于；单数的；奇怪的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He has now appeared in sixty odd films.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. a sailor serving on the same ship as another 同船水手
n. 甲板
vi. form a close group around 群集  n. 群，簇，丛
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The boys and girls clustered together round the camp fire telling stories and singing songs.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. a sailor on a ship 海员，水手，水兵
v.  (cause to) curve outward （使）鼓胀
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. His pocket was bulging with sweets.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. the amount that a fist can hold 一把
a. following one after the other 接连不断的，连续的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. After four successive election defeats, the Labour Party once again faces the painful task of reconstruction.

NewWords.WordPhrase: one by one 挨个地，轮流地
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The freshmen called out their names in turn.

NewWords.WordPhrase: prep. in the middle of, among 在……当中，在……之间
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Children were changing classrooms amid laughter and shouts.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. make humble 使谦卑，使卑下
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I see no point in humbling myself before my creditors.

NewWords.WordPhrase: (underwent, undergone) vt. go through, experience 经过，经历
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. No one can force you to undergo a medical examination.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a.  rapid, prompt 迅疾的，即时的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Because of the swift, enormous growth of the urban areas many farmers leave their villages to go to cities where there is work.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 放心，确信
vt. recognize the quality or significance of, value 赏识，重视
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Professor Smith's general comments may help students to appreciate the theories in the textbook.

NewWords.WordPhrase: cause to return to the mind 回想起
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The old photographs brought back many pleasant memories of my college life.

NewWords.WordPhrase: instantly 一瞬间
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The answer to the math question came to him in a flash.

NewWords.WordPhrase: (wept) v. shed (tears), cry because of 流（泪），（为……而）哭泣
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She lost control of her feelings and began to weep.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 尿布  vt. put a diaper on 给……衬尿布
n. a living thing, esp. a person 生命，人
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. People expect a horse to perform like a car, with no thought for its feelings as a living being.

NewWords.WordPhrase: behave; keep busy doing (sth.) ; set about 表现；忙于；着手
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. It's unprofessional to go about criticizing your colleagues.

NewWords.WordPhrase: secretly 秘密地，暗自
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The negotiators were meeting in secret for several months before the peace agreement was reached.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. repeat or copy the words of (another) 引用，引述
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. To close, I would like to quote Benjamin Franklin, "One should eat to live, not live to eat."

NewWords.WordPhrase: ad. to a great degree, very much 在很大程度上，非常
n. writing paper and envelopes, writing materials and office supplies 信纸信封；文具
